Package net.kemitix.mon.experimental.either

Interface Either<L,​R>

Type Parameters:
L - the type of the Either for left value
R - the type of the Either for right value
public interface Either<L,​R>
An Either type for holding a one of two possible values, a left and a right, that may be of different types.
Author:
Paul Campbell (pcampbell@kemitix.net)

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    <T> Either<T,​R>
    flatMapLeft​(Function<L,​Either<T,​R>> f)
    FlatMap the function across the left value.
    <T> Either<L,​T>
    flatMapRight​(Function<R,​Either<L,​T>> f)
    FlatMap the function across the right value.
    Optional<L>
    getLeft()
    Returns an Optional containing the left value, if is a left, otherwise returns an empty Optional.
    Optional<R>
    getRight()
    Returns an Optional containing the right value, if is a right, otherwise returns an empty Optional.

    Checks if the Either holds a left value.

      R - the type of the right value

      l - the left value
      Returns:

      Parameters:

      Returns:
      a Either holding the right value

    • isLeft

      boolean isLeft()
      Checks if the Either holds a left value.
      Returns:
      true if this Either is a left

    • isRight

      boolean isRight()
      Checks if the Either holds a right value.
      Returns:
      true if this Either is a right

    • match

      void match​(Consumer<L> onLeft, Consumer<R> onRight)
      Matches the Either, invoking the correct Consumer.
      Parameters:
      onLeft - the Consumer to invoke when the Either is a left
      onRight - the Consumer to invoke when the Either is a right

    • mapLeft

      <T> Either<T,​R> mapLeft​(Function<L,​T> f)
      Map the function across the left value.
      Type Parameters:
      T - the type to change the left value to
      Parameters:
      f - the function to apply to any left value
      Returns:
      a new Either

      <T> Either<T,​R> flatMapLeft​(Function<L,​Either<T,​R>> f)
      FlatMap the function across the left value.
      Type Parameters:
      T - the type to change the left value to
      Parameters:
      f - the function to apply to any left value
      Returns:
      a new Either if is a Left, else this

    • flatMapRight

      <T> Either<L,​T> flatMapRight​(Function<R,​Either<L,​T>> f)

      Parameters:

    • getLeft

      Optional<L> getLeft()
      Returns an Optional containing the left value, if is a left, otherwise returns an empty Optional.
      Returns:
      An Optional containing any left value

    • getRight

      Optional<R> getRight()
      Returns an Optional containing the right value, if is a right, otherwise returns an empty Optional.
      Returns:
      An Optional containing any right value
